intro: Dipteracanthus longepetiolatus, commonly known as the long-petioled dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated petioles and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a serrated margin. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
